segments.text: So, this is the spot where Narottam Das Thakur had his last Leela.
Narottam Das Thakur was absorbed in singing the glories of Lord Gauranga and Nityananda, day and night.
By the mercy of his lotus feet, several atheists, agnostics, offenders, demigod worshippers, dry logicians, speculators, etc. were all delivered.
Hearing the terrible news of the disappearance of Sri Ramachandra Kaviraj, who was a very dear friend,
Narottama plunged into an ocean of grief.
Added to his grief, shortly, the spiritual master of Ramachandra, Sri Srinivasacharya, also left this planet.
Arriving at Gambila, Narottam Das Thakur ordered his disciples, Sri Ramakrishna and Ganga Narayan Chakravarti, to arrange for his bathing in Padma.
He entered the waters after repeatedly paying his obeisances.
Standing there in the water, he then ordered his disciples to wipe his body.
Then, as Ganga Narayan and Ramakrishna were cleansing the body of their spiritual master, Sri Narottama merged into the waters of Padma and vanished from worldly view.
His disappearance was just as milk vanishes in water.
It is believed that Thakur Mahasaya wrapped up his earthly Leela and manifested his disappearance.
In the year 1611 A.D., the bank of Bajirathi, where Narottama Das Thakur entered the river and vanished, just as milk dissolves in water, is now known as Duktha and is an exalted place of pilgrimage.
So, that is the very spot we are sitting in, the greatest spot, the greatest devotee of Chaitanya Mahaprabhu.

Next, Bada Govinda Bari, the Golden Gauranga Deity.
At Bada Govinda Bari Temple, rests today the enchanting Golden Gauranga Deity, that was
once worshipped by Narottam Das Thakura.
There is a very interesting pastime regarding how Narottam Das Thakur discovered this Gauranga
Deity.
In the province of Gopalpur, there lived a pious Brahmana.
He was a Brahmin.
He was a Brahmin.
He was a Brahmin.
His name was Vipra Dasa.
Mahaprabhu revealed to Narottam Das Thakura in his dream one night that his beloved Gauravishnupriya
Deities were presently resting at the house of this Brahmana.
These Deities lay hidden in his huge container of paddy.
When Mahaprabhu left Bengal for Puri, after accepting his sannyas initiation, he manifested
these enchanting Deities and hid them inside his paddy.
In the course of time, they landed up in the house of this Brahmana.
But this Brahmana was completely unaware of this.
So when Narottam Das Thakur arrived at the house of this Brahmana the next day and wanted
to look into his huge mount of paddy, the Brahmana warned him that a huge venomous snake
lived in it, and it was not safe to go near it.
Regardless, Shri Narottama entered the paddy container.
He was very happy.
He entered the paddy container, and immediately the huge snake appeared and walked out of
the mount.
All present were very filled with wonder.
Soon Thakura Mahasaya discovered his beloved Gauravishnupriya Deities from the paddy and
grabbed them dearly.
The onlookers began loudly glorifying Narottam Das and shouted,
